item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [two_thirds] Front-End Developer New York, NY Overview Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. In order that people may be happy in their work, these three things are needed: They must be fit for it. They must not do too much of it. And they must have a sense of success in it. Knowledge & Qualifications Excellent HTML & CSS skills JavaScript – jQuery or MooTools experience GIT / SVN experience Advanced knowledge of WordPress theme development Familiarity with cross browser issues Experience with Adobe products Fluent English HTML5 & CSS3 is a plus Applicants must send their resume with a link to an online portfolio for consideration. item.content:encoded: [two_thirds] History There are many variations of passages of Lorem Ipsum available, but the majority have suffered alteration in some form, by injected humour, or randomised words which don’t look even slightly believable. If you are going to use a passage of Lorem Ipsum, you need to be sure there isn’t anything embarrassing hidden in the middle of text. All the Lorem Ipsum generators on the Internet tend to repeat predefined chunks as necessary, making this the first true generator on the Internet. Philosophy It uses a dictionary of over 200 Latin words, combined with a handful of model sentence structures, to generate Lorem Ipsum which looks reasonable. The generated Lorem Ipsum is therefore always free. Originally published in Spanish in 1605, Cervantes’ satire about a gentle visionary who becomes a knight after reading too many chivalric romances is a universal tale of idealism versus practicality. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including. item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[push h="20"]

[five_sixths]

If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask?

[/five_sixths] [one_sixth_last] [/one_sixth_last]     [two_thirds]

Progressio Theme

[accordions mini="true"] [accordion title="How to enjoy life?"]You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry, don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.[/accordion] [accordion title="Do I need to read often?"]Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings, so that you shall gain easily what others have labored hard for.[/accordion] [accordion title="Can I work from home?"]Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. In order that people may be happy in their work, these three things are needed: They must be fit for it. They must not do too much of it. And they must have a sense of success in it. [/accordion] [accordion title="Are you a Human Being?"]All that we are is the result of what we have thought. If a man speaks or acts with an evil thought, pain follows him. If a man speaks or acts with a pure thought, happiness follows him, like a shadow that never leaves him.[/accordion] [accordion title="What is needed to become a poet?"]I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.[/accordion] [accordion title="How to practice MMA?"]It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.[/accordion] [accordion title="Do I need colors, when painting?"]Sixteen million colors in your palette are hard for any artist, especially a beginner, to turn down.[/accordion] [accordion title="What does it take to become a vegetarian?"]I am not a vegetarian because I love animals; I am a vegetarian because I hate plants.[/accordion] [accordion title="Is there anything at all you can not do?"]Talent does what it can; genius does what it must.[/accordion] [/accordions]

Studium Theme

[accordions mini="true"] [accordion title="How to enjoy life?"]You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry, don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.[/accordion] [accordion title="Do I need to read often?"]Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings, so that you shall gain easily what others have labored hard for.[/accordion] [accordion title="Can I work from home?"]Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. In order that people may be happy in their work, these three things are needed: They must be fit for it. They must not do too much of it. And they must have a sense of success in it. [/accordion] [accordion title="Are you a Human Being?"]All that we are is the result of what we have thought. If a man speaks or acts with an evil thought, pain follows him. If a man speaks or acts with a pure thought, happiness follows him, like a shadow that never leaves him.[/accordion] [accordion title="What is needed to become a poet?"]I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.[/accordion] [accordion title="How to practice MMA?"]It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. item.title: Services
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[push h="20"] Our design services will deliver you a  competitive product. [push h="20"] [one_third] [/one_third] [two_thirds_last] But, how do we do this? We take a user experience design approach to your project. User experience is the simple philosophy that your products or services should be optimised and designed with your specific users in mind. We help you research, define and consult with your users as your product evolves. We also listen to you, to learn about your organisation and your objectives. This insight helps us create a balanced strategy for your product and shapes its very features, behaviour, structure and visual identity. The result is a significantly more usable and profitable product; making your organisation more competitive and your users very happy. [/two_thirds_last] [divider_2] [push h="20"]

Our Services in Detail

[five_sixths] Our services consist of a range of strategic tools and user-centred design techniques. Because every project is unique, we use these services like a toolkit and only recommend those which are most appropriate for your organisation. Whichever services we use for your project, our focus is always on delivering a measurably successful product that offers a rewarding user experience. [push h="20"] [/five_sixths] [divider_2] [push h="20"] [one_fourth] [one_fifth] [push h="20"] [icon style="tag" color="gray" size="medium"] [/icon] [/one_fifth] [four_fifths_last] [push h="15"]

item.title: Why Us?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[push h="30"]

"I'm a great believer in luck,

and I find the harder I work,

the more I have of it."

Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Careers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[two_thirds]

Working With Us

[push h="10"] Vamtam is committed to helping employees feel valued and inspired. We aim to attract, retain, empower, and motivate our employees and to create an inclusive environment where all feel welcome. [divider_1]

Benefits

Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has. [divider_1]

Career Development

Vamtam is committed to offering tools and resources to help employees succeed at work and in life. [divider_1]

Diversity

At Vamtam, we believe that in an increasingly multicultural world, we have to expand our efforts to reach and understand the diverse people and cultures we serve. [divider_1]

Going Green

Environmental issues are important to us all, and we want to do our best to reduce our company’s environmental footprint on the globe as much as possible. [divider_1]

Our Stories

At Vamtam, we strive to hire and retain a workforce as diverse as our customer base. Get to know Vamtam through its employees' unique voices. [/two_thirds] [one_third_last] [slogan nopadding="false" carved="false" background="#ededed"]
OPEN POSITION
[push h="10"]
Lead Developer
Front End Developer
Wordpress Guru
Web Designer
[divider_1]
SUBMIT YOUR RESUME
[push h="10"]
We value our employees and provide high-quality, comprehensive employee benefits programs to support their well-being.

I hate [lightbox title="" group="london-lightbox" href="http://www.visitlondon.com/" width="100%" height="100%" class="" iframe="true" photo="false" close="true"] [highlight type="dark"]London[/highlight] [/lightbox] when it's not raining. Groucho Marx[/one_fourth] [one_fourth] When it's three o'clock in New York, it's still 1938 in [lightbox title="" group="london-lightbox" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/MzJMTKXB0iw" width="100%" height="100%" class="" iframe="true" photo="false" close="true"] [highlight type="light"]London[/highlight] [/lightbox].Bette Midler[/one_fourth] [one_fourth_last]By seeing [lightbox title="" group="london-lightbox" href="{WPV:SAMPLES_URI}small.jpg" width="" height="" class="" iframe="false" photo="true" close="false"] [highlight type="light"]London[/highlight] [/lightbox], I have seen as much of life as the world can show. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. In order that people may be happy in their work, these three things are needed: They must be fit for it. They must not do too much of it. And they must have a sense of success in it.[/accordion] [/accordions] [/two_thirds] [one_third_last] [/one_third_last] [push h="15"] [toggle title="Get the code" hidden="true"] [pre] [two_thirds] [accordions mini="false"] [accordion title="Can you slice my PSD to a valid HTML/CSS layout?"]And the only important thing is not to allow that to scare you[/accordion] [accordion title="Which JavaScript library is the best for my case?"]The future is called “perhaps,” which is the only possible thing to call the future.[/accordion] [accordion title="Do I need special software to work with my website?"]Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. Columns

One half
If a man is called a streetsweeper, he should sweep streets even as Michelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music, or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and Earth will pause to say, Here lived a great streetsweeper who did his job well. [/one_half] [one_half_last]
One half
Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. [/one_half_last]   [one_fifth]
One fifth
Advertisers in general bear a large part of the responsibility for the deep feelings of inadequacy that drive women to psychiatrists, pills, or the bottle. [/one_fifth] [one_fifth]
One fifth
Our society's values are being corrupted by advertising's insistence on the equation: Youth equals popularity, popularity equals success, success equals happiness.[/one_fifth] [one_fifth]
One fifth
The trouble with us in America isn't that the poetry of life has turned to prose, but that it has turned to advertising copy.[/one_fifth] [one_fifth]
One fifth
Don't tell my mother I work in an advertising agency - she thinks I play piano in a whorehouse.[/one_fifth] [one_fifth_last]
One fifth
The very first law in advertising is to avoid the concrete promise and cultivate the delightfully vague. [/one_fifth_last]   [one_third]

Oh how we love pumpkin season. You did know this gourd-ish squash has its own season, right? Winter, Spring, Summer, Pumpkin.... We anxiously anticipate it every year. [/one_fourth] [one_fourth]

Youth is like spring, an over praised season more remarkable for biting winds than genial breezes. Autumn is the mellower season, and what we lose in flowers we more than gain in fruits. [/one_fourth] [one_fourth_last]

[dropcap1 color=""]A[/dropcap1] ll my life I had been looking for something, and everywhere I turned someone tried to tell me what it was. I accepted their answers too, though they were often in contradiction and even self-contradictory. I was naive. I was looking for myself and asking everyone except myself questions which I, and only I, could answer. [toggle title="Get the code" hidden="true"] [pre] [dropcap1 color=""]A[/dropcap1] [/pre] [/toggle] [/one_half] [one_half_last]

[dropcap2 color=""]T[/dropcap2] he great majority of us are required to live a life of constant duplicity.Your health is bound to be affected if, day after day, you say the opposite of what you feel, if you grovel before what you dislike, and rejoice at what brings you nothing but misfortune. Blockquote
Over second and third cups flow matters of high finance, high state, common gossip and low comedy. Coffee is a social binder, a warmer of tongues, a soberer of minds, a stimulant of wit, a foiler of sleep if you want it so. From roadside mugs to the classic demi-tasse, it is the perfect democrat. [push h="15"]
Originally published in Spanish in 1605, Cervantes’ satire about a gentle visionary who becomes a knight after reading too many chivalric romances is a universal tale of idealism versus practicality.D. Servantes
[push h="15"] This coffee falls into your stomach, and straightway there is a general commotion. Ideas begin to move like the battalions of the Grand Army of the battlefield, and the battle takes place. Things remembered arrive at full gallop, ensuing to the wind. [toggle title="Get the code" hidden="true"] [pre]

item.title: Widgets
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
We understand you

[push h="10"] Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. In order that people may be happy in their work, these three things are needed: They must be fit for it. They must not do too much of it. And they must have a sense of success in it.  

We create trends

[push h="10"] It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution of letters. Many desktop publishing packages and web page editors now use Lorem Ipsum as their default model text, and a search for ‘lorem ipsum’ will uncover many web sites still in their infancy. Various versions have evolved over the years, sometimes by accident, sometimes on purpose (injected humour and the like).  

You have a role in the project

Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago. [push h="20"] It uses a dictionary of over 200 Latin words, combined with a handful of model sentence structures, to generate Lorem Ipsum which looks reasonable. The generated Lorem Ipsum is therefore always free. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution of letters, as opposed to using ‘Content here, content here’, making it look like readable English. Many desktop publishing packages and web page editors now use Lorem Ipsum as their default model text, and a search for ‘lorem ipsum’ will uncover many web sites still in their infancy. Various versions have evolved over the years, sometimes by accident, sometimes on purpose (injected humour and the like). Aristotle  - 384—322 , Greek philosopher, b. Stagira. He is sometimes called the Stagirite. [push h="10"] Aristotle's father, Nicomachus, was a noted physician. Aristotle studied (367—347 ) under Plato at the Academy and there wrote many dialogues that were praised for their eloquence. Only fragments of these dialogues are extant. [push h="10"] He tutored (342—c.339 ) Alexander the Great at the Macedonian court, left to live in Stagira, and then returned to Athens. In 335 he opened a school in the Lyceum; some distinguished members of the Academy followed him. His practice of lecturing in the Lyceum's portico, or covered walking place (peripatos), gave his school the name Peripatetic. During the anti-Macedonian agitation after Alexander's death, Aristotle fled in 323 to Chalcis, where he died. Aristotle's extant writings consist largely of his written versions of his lectures; some passages appear to be interpolations of notes made by his students; the texts were edited and given their present form by [highlight type="dark"]Andronicus[/highlight]  of Rhodes in the 1st cent. Chief among them are the Organum, consisting of six treatises on logic; Physics; Metaphysics; De Anima [on the soul]; Nicomachean Ethics and Eudemian Ethics; De Poetica [poetics]; Rhetoric; and a series of works on biology and physics. In the late 19th cent. his Constitution of Athens, an account of Athenian government, was found. Aristotle was appointed as the head of the royal academy of Macedon. During that time he gave lessons not only to Alexander, but also to two other future kings: Ptolemy and Cassander. In his Politics, Aristotle states that only one thing could justify monarchy, and that was if the virtue of the king and his family were greater than the virtue of the rest of the citizens put together. Tactfully, he included the young prince and his father in that category. Aristotle encouraged Alexander toward eastern conquest, and his attitude towards Persia was unabashedly ethnocentric. In one famous example, he counsels Alexander to be 'a leader to the Greeks and a despot to the barbarians, to look after the former as after friends and relatives, and to deal with the latter as with beasts or plants'. By 335 BC he had returned to Athens, establishing his own school there known as the Lyceum. Aristotle conducted courses at the school for the next twelve years. While in Athens, his wife Pythias died and Aristotle became involved with Herpyllis of Stageira, who bore him a son whom he named after his father, Nicomachus. According to the Suda, he also had an eromenos, Palaephatus of Abydus. It is during this period in Athens from 335 to 323 BC when Aristotle is believed to have composed many of his works. Aristotle wrote many dialogues, only fragments of which survived. The works that have survived are in treatise form and were not, for the most part, intended for widespread publication, as they are generally thought to be lecture aids for his students. His most important treatises include Physics, Metaphysics, Nicomachean Ethics, Politics, De Anima (On the Soul) and Poetics.   [push h="20"]

item.title: Smart Man vs. Wise Man
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[two_thirds]

OVERVIEW

Aristotle made several efforts to explain how moral conduct contributes to the good life for human agents, including the Eqikh EudaimonhV and the Magna Moralia, but the most complete surviving statement of his views on morality occurs in the Eqikh Nikomacoi . [push h="10"] There he considered the natural desire to achieve happiness, described the operation of human volition and moral deliberation, developed a theory of each virtue as the mean between vicious extremes, discussed the value of three kinds of friendship, and defended his conception of an ideal life of intellectual pursuit. [push h="10"] But on Aristotle’s view, the lives of individual human beings are invariably linked together in a social context. In the Peri PoliV he speculated about the origins of the state, described and assessed the relative merits of various types of government, and listed the obligations of the individual citizen. [/two_thirds] [one_third_last]

item.title: Why Buy The Theme ?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[push h="20"]

The Vamtam guarantee

[push h="30"] [one_fourth]

Always up to date

[/one_fourth] [one_fourth]

Timely support

[/one_fourth] [one_fourth]

Browser compatibility 

[/one_fourth] [one_fourth_last]

Video tutorials for beginners

[push h="16"] [/one_fourth_last] [divider_2] [push h="20"]

Top notch customer support

[push h="10"]
  • 20+ video tutorials for beginners
  • If you ever have a problem, we have a dedicated support staff ready to assist you.
  • Тhere are little helpers everywhere in the interface, that let you retrieve quick information about the particular fields you are currently viewing.
[divider_2] [push h="20"]

One click auto install of widgets and content

[push h="10"]
  • Sample data and configuration is available for customers to try and see local demo of the theme.
  • Widget importer.
[divider_2] [push h="20"]

Powerful admin panel

[push h="10"]
  • Drag & drop layout editor
  • Drag & drop slider management
  • Shortcode generator.
  • Tons of shortcodes with tiny MCE visual integration!
[divider_2] [push h="20"]

Endless layout possibilities. Boxed and full layout.

[push h="20"]

  • Any page can be home page. Set-up your own home page as you wish!
  • Flexible 6 sidebars in body and in footer
  • Flexible left, right or both sidebars on inner pages and posts
  • Unlimited Dynamic Sidebars
  • Unique widget areas for posts/pages
[divider_2] [push h="20"]

Unlimited styles

[push h="10"] Theme skin switcher with 8 predefined skins. 200+ Shortcodes All our themes include Custom Shortcodes that allow you to easily add buttons, boxes, social buttons, columns andmore to your posts, pages and widgets. Fullscreen background slider and images Set a different background image for each page Set a different background color for each page 55 + color pickers to style every element The theme will let you customize the style and typography of every element in the design. Packed with 100+ options, it allows you to make your website look exactly like you want! [divider_2] [push h="20"]

Re-sizable full screen slider

[push h="10"]
  • Custom made jQuery slider!
  • Drag & drop slider management
  • Boxed and full width slider
  • 6 slider styles
[divider_2] [push h="20"]

Sidebar manager

[push h="10"] Custom sidebars for posts and pages Sidebar Manager allows you to replace all widgetized sidebars in our themes with unique custom sidebar. [divider_2] [push h="20"]

11 custom widgets

[push h="10"] [one_fourth]
  • Vamtam Post Formats Widget
  • Vamtam Ads Widget
  • Vamtam Video Widget
  • Vamtam Popular Posts Widget
  • Vamtam Contact Widget
  • Vamtam Twitter Widget
  • Vamtam Sub Navigation
  • Vamtam Flickr Widget
  • Vamtam Social Icons Widget
  • Vamtam Google Map Widget
  • Vamtam Author Widget
  [/one_fourth] [divider_2] [push h="20"]

Tech-savy

[push h="10"]
  • Vamtam Rock Solid Theme Framework
  • Lighting fast
  • Valid HTML5 and CSS 3 tableless design. Designed primarily with CSS, minimal graphics means minimal load-time.
  • Consistent code structure
  • No timb tumb
  • Meta programming in setting pages
  • Very well commented and clean code
  • Pixel perfect design
  • Custom post type support for Portfolios and Slides
  • Unobtrusive jQuery powered effects
[divider_2] [push h="20"]

Complete localisation

[push h="10"] [five_sixths_last]Full Localization Support (contains .po/.mo files) All of our themes have been localized for easy translation. Included with each theme are sets of .mo and .po files that can be used to translate the theme, which means you wont have to spend hours searching through PHP files for English words. WPML support [/five_sixths_last] [divider_2] [push h="20"]

Font replacement

[push h="10"] [one_half_last] You can change any text on your site to the font of your liking and you can preview fonts in the admin panel
  • Google fonts support
  • Font Face
[/one_half_last] [divider_2] [push h="20"]

SEO friendly

[push h="10"] Built with semantic best practices and search engines in mind!

If you want to say “Hi, everyone” just drop us a line: office@vamtam.com [/one_third] [two_thirds_last] [accordions mini="false"] [accordion title="Can you slice my PSD to a valid HTML/CSS layout?"]And the only important thing is not to allow that to scare you[/accordion] [accordion title="Which JavaScript library is the best for my case?"]The future is called “perhaps,” which is the only possible thing to call the future.[/accordion] [accordion title="Do I need special software to work with my website?"]Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. In order that people may be happy in their work, these three things are needed: They must be fit for it. They must not do too much of it. We help you research, define and consult with your users as your product evolves. We also listen to you, to learn about your organisation and your objectives. This insight helps us create a balanced strategy for your product and shapes its very features, behaviour, structure and visual identity. Working With Us

[push h="10"] Vamtam is committed to helping employees feel valued and inspired. We aim to attract, retain, empower, and motivate our employees and to create an inclusive environment where all feel welcome. [divider_1]

Benefits

Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has. [divider_1]

Career Development

Vamtam is committed to offering tools and resources to help employees succeed at work and in life. [divider_1]

Diversity

At Vamtam, we believe that in an increasingly multicultural world, we have to expand our efforts to reach and understand the diverse people and cultures we serve. [divider_1]

Going Green

Environmental issues are important to us all, and we want to do our best to reduce our company’s environmental footprint on the globe as much as possible. [divider_1]

Our Stories

At Vamtam, we strive to hire and retain a workforce as diverse as our customer base. Get to know Vamtam through its employees' unique voices. [/two_thirds] [one_third_last] [slogan nopadding="false" carved="false" background="#ededed"]

OVERVIEW

Aristotle made several efforts to explain how moral conduct contributes to the good life for human agents, including the Eqikh EudaimonhV and the Magna Moralia, but the most complete surviving statement of his views on morality occurs in the Eqikh Nikomacoi . [push h="10"] There he considered the natural desire to achieve happiness, described the operation of human volition and moral deliberation, developed a theory of each virtue as the mean between vicious extremes, discussed the value of three kinds of friendship, and defended his conception of an ideal life of intellectual pursuit. [push h="10"] But on Aristotle’s view, the lives of individual human beings are invariably linked together in a social context. In the Peri PoliV he speculated about the origins of the state, described and assessed the relative merits of various types of government, and listed the obligations of the individual citizen. [/two_thirds] [one_third_last]

Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago. Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. [push h="30"]

"I'm a great believer in luck,

and I find the harder I work,

the more I have of it."

Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Smart Man vs. Wise Man
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[push h="10"]

An experiment to repeat a test of the speed of subatomic particles known as neutrinos has found that they do not travel faster than light.Results announced in September suggested that neutrinos can exceed light speed, but were met with scepticism as that would upend Einstein's theory of relativity.

A test run by a different group at the same laboratory has now clocked them travelling at precisely light speed. The results have been posted online.

The results in September, from the Opera group at the Gran Sasso underground laboratory in Italy, shocked the world, threatening to upend a century of physics as well as relativity - which holds the speed of light to be the Universe's absolute speed limit.

Now the Icarus group, based at the same laboratory, has weighed in again, having already cast some doubt on the original Opera claim.

[push h="10"]

Shortly after that claim, Nobel laureate Sheldon Glashow co-authored a Physical Review Letters paper that modelled how faster-than-light neutrinos would behave as they travelled.

[push h="10"]

In November, the Icarus group showed in a paper posted on the online server Arxiv that the neutrinos displayed no such behaviour.

However, they have now supplemented that indirect result with a test just like that carried out by the Opera team.

[push h="20"]

Speedy result

The Icarus experiment uses 600 tonnes - 430,000 litres - of liquid argon to detect the arrival of neutrinos sent through 730km of rock from the Cern laboratory in Switzerland.

Since their November result, the Icarus team have adjusted their experiment to do a speed measurement. Continue reading the main story “Start Quote

I didn't trust the result right from the beginning”

[highlight type="light"]Sandro Centro Icarus collaboration[/highlight]

What was missing was information from Cern about the departure time of the neutrinos, which the team recently received to complete their analysis.

The result: they find that the neutrinos do travel at the same speed as light, within a small error range.

[push h="20"]

item.title: Wars
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[two_thirds]

OVERVIEW

Aristotle made several efforts to explain how moral conduct contributes to the good life for human agents, including the Eqikh EudaimonhV and the Magna Moralia, but the most complete surviving statement of his views on morality occurs in the Eqikh Nikomacoi . [push h="10"] There he considered the natural desire to achieve happiness, described the operation of human volition and moral deliberation, developed a theory of each virtue as the mean between vicious extremes, discussed the value of three kinds of friendship, and defended his conception of an ideal life of intellectual pursuit. [push h="10"] But on Aristotle’s view, the lives of individual human beings are invariably linked together in a social context. In the Peri PoliV he speculated about the origins of the state, described and assessed the relative merits of various types of government, and listed the obligations of the individual citizen. [/two_thirds] [one_third_last]

DETAILS

Lockheed Martin Ltd

item.title: Risk Reward Ratio
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[two_thirds]

OVERVIEW

Aristotle made several efforts to explain how moral conduct contributes to the good life for human agents, including the Eqikh EudaimonhV and the Magna Moralia, but the most complete surviving statement of his views on morality occurs in the Eqikh Nikomacoi . [push h="10"] There he considered the natural desire to achieve happiness, described the operation of human volition and moral deliberation, developed a theory of each virtue as the mean between vicious extremes, discussed the value of three kinds of friendship, and defended his conception of an ideal life of intellectual pursuit. [push h="10"] But on Aristotle’s view, the lives of individual human beings are invariably linked together in a social context. In the Peri PoliV he speculated about the origins of the state, described and assessed the relative merits of various types of government, and listed the obligations of the individual citizen. [/two_thirds] [one_third_last]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago. Working from home meant we could vary snack and coffee breaks, change our desks or view, goof off, drink on the job, even spend the day in pajamas, and often meet to gossip or share ideas. On the other hand, we bossed ourselves around, set impossible goals, and demanded longer hours than office jobs usually entail. It was the ultimate “flextime,” in that it depended on how flexible we felt each day, given deadlines, distractions, and workaholic crescendos. [push h="30"]

"I'm a great believer in luck,

and I find the harder I work,

the more I have of it."

Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Quality is not an act. It is a habit
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[push h="10"]

An experiment to repeat a test of the speed of subatomic particles known as neutrinos has found that they do not travel faster than light.Results announced in September suggested that neutrinos can exceed light speed, but were met with scepticism as that would upend Einstein's theory of relativity.

A test run by a different group at the same laboratory has now clocked them travelling at precisely light speed. The results have been posted online.

The results in September, from the Opera group at the Gran Sasso underground laboratory in Italy, shocked the world, threatening to upend a century of physics as well as relativity - which holds the speed of light to be the Universe's absolute speed limit.

Now the Icarus group, based at the same laboratory, has weighed in again, having already cast some doubt on the original Opera claim.

[push h="10"]

Shortly after that claim, Nobel laureate Sheldon Glashow co-authored a Physical Review Letters paper that modelled how faster-than-light neutrinos would behave as they travelled.

[push h="10"]

In November, the Icarus group showed in a paper posted on the online server Arxiv that the neutrinos displayed no such behaviour.

However, they have now supplemented that indirect result with a test just like that carried out by the Opera team.

[push h="20"]

Speedy result

The Icarus experiment uses 600 tonnes - 430,000 litres - of liquid argon to detect the arrival of neutrinos sent through 730km of rock from the Cern laboratory in Switzerland.

Since their November result, the Icarus team have adjusted their experiment to do a speed measurement. Continue reading the main story “Start Quote

I didn't trust the result right from the beginning”

[highlight type="light"]Sandro Centro Icarus collaboration[/highlight]

What was missing was information from Cern about the departure time of the neutrinos, which the team recently received to complete their analysis.

The result: they find that the neutrinos do travel at the same speed as light, within a small error range.

[push h="20"]

item.content:encoded:
[push h="10"]

An experiment to repeat a test of the speed of subatomic particles known as neutrinos has found that they do not travel faster than light.Results announced in September suggested that neutrinos can exceed light speed, but were met with scepticism as that would upend Einstein's theory of relativity.

A test run by a different group at the same laboratory has now clocked them travelling at precisely light speed. The results have been posted online.

The results in September, from the Opera group at the Gran Sasso underground laboratory in Italy, shocked the world, threatening to upend a century of physics as well as relativity - which holds the speed of light to be the Universe's absolute speed limit.

Now the Icarus group, based at the same laboratory, has weighed in again, having already cast some doubt on the original Opera claim.

[push h="10"]

Shortly after that claim, Nobel laureate Sheldon Glashow co-authored a Physical Review Letters paper that modelled how faster-than-light neutrinos would behave as they travelled.

[push h="10"]

In November, the Icarus group showed in a paper posted on the online server Arxiv that the neutrinos displayed no such behaviour.

However, they have now supplemented that indirect result with a test just like that carried out by the Opera team.

[push h="20"]

Speedy result

The Icarus experiment uses 600 tonnes - 430,000 litres - of liquid argon to detect the arrival of neutrinos sent through 730km of rock from the Cern laboratory in Switzerland.

Since their November result, the Icarus team have adjusted their experiment to do a speed measurement. Continue reading the main story “Start Quote

I didn't trust the result right from the beginning”

[highlight type="light"]Sandro Centro Icarus collaboration[/highlight]

What was missing was information from Cern about the departure time of the neutrinos, which the team recently received to complete their analysis.

The result: they find that the neutrinos do travel at the same speed as light, within a small error range.

[push h="20"]

item.title: An advertising agency is 85 % confusion and 15 % commission.
